meanings.definition: To form a cartel or join a cartel.
meanings.sent1: The companies were cartelizing to control the market.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of cartelizing with her competitors to fix prices.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon characters were cartelizing to monopolize the ice cream market.
meanings.sent4: The students were cartelizing their resources to ace the group project.
meanings.sent5: The ants were cartelizing their efforts to gather food efficiently.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or participating in a cartel.
meanings.sent1: Cartelizing can lead to unfair competition in the industry.
meanings.sent2: The cartelizing of certain industries can harm consumers.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about animals cartelizing in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The novel depicted a world where cartelizing was the norm in business.
meanings.sent5: The documentary explored the consequences of cartelizing in the economy.
